meanings.definition: Convert (organic matter) into a mineral substance.
meanings.sent1: The ancient bones were mineralized over time, turning into stone.
meanings.sent2: The process of fossilization mineralized the remains of the prehistoric creatures.
meanings.sent3: When the tree fell into the mineral-rich water, it got mineralized and became a crystal tree!
meanings.sent4: Her love for geology mineralized her passion for rocks and minerals.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell mineralized the ordinary sand into precious gems.

meanings.definition: Impregnate or permeate with mineral substances.
meanings.sent1: The underground water slowly mineralized the cave walls, creating stunning formations.
meanings.sent2: The hot springs mineralized the rocks, giving them a unique color and texture.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was a mineralized salt that enhanced the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes mineralized the canvas, adding depth and richness to the painting.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption mineralized the surrounding landscape, forever changing its appearance.
